intro: [WRONG START] Prenanthes alba var. septentaria, commonly known as the white ray flover or white rayed water hemlock, is a herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It features a slender, branching stem that often grows up to 1 meter in height. The plant produces small, white, umbrella-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and have a rough texture. It is important to note that this plant is toxic and should not be ingested or handled without proper caution.
